sentences.sContent: He knew he had found Lord Kelvin’s unknown source of heat.
sentences.sContent_eng: He knew he had found Lord Kelvin’s unknown source of heat.
sentences.sCn: 他知道他发现了开尔文勋爵所说的来源不明的热量。

sentences.sContent: "The stability against freezing of Martian fluids can explain saline water activity on the surface of Mars at mean global temperatures well below 273 Kelvin," they wrote.
sentences.sContent_eng: "The stability against freezing of Martian fluids can explain saline water activity on the surface of Mars at mean global temperatures well below 273 Kelvin," they wrote.
sentences.sCn: 他们写道，“稳定对火星流体冻结还可以可以解释在全球平均气温远低于273开尔文下火星表面的盐水活动。”

synos.tran: 开尔文（英国物理学家，数学家）；凯尔文（男子名）；绝对温标

trans.tranCn: 绝对温标；凯尔文（男子名）；[热] 开尔文（英国物理学家，数学家）
trans.tranOther: a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 273.15 K and boils at 373.15 K
